intro: Hyalosperma glutinosum, commonly known as the sticky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, green, sticky seeds that adhere to animals and clothing, aiding in seed dispersal. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellowish in color. Hyalosperma glutinosum is a low-growing perennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local ecosystems.
